MS MCQs

    Manage users and implement security in Business Central

    »

    1. How do you create a new user in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central?

      To add users in Business Central, your company’s administrator must create the users in the Users window by using the Create User action. Users are assigned permission sets depending on the plan assigned to the User in Microsoft 365.

      To add users in Business Central, your company’s Microsoft 365 administrator must first create the users in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center. Once users are created in Microsoft 365, they can be imported into the Users window by using the Get Users from Microsoft 365 action.

      To add users in Business Central, your company’s administrator must create the users in the User Setup window, and then run the Synchronize with Microsoft 365 action.

      To add users in Business Central, you need to add new users in an Excel file and then use the data migration wizard to import those users into the system.


    2. Which of the following statements about permission sets is true?

      By default, no permission sets are available in the database.

      All users must be assigned multiple permission sets before they can access Business Central.

      A permission set is a collection of permissions for specific objects in the database. All users must be assigned one or more permission sets before they can access Business Central. Several predefined permission sets are provided by default. You can use these permission sets as already defined. You can’t modify default permission sets but can create new Tenant permission sets.

      Permissions need to be created and assigned every time a user is added to the system.
